references.paper_title: Calibrating noise to sensitivity in private data analysis
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of differential privacy, introducing the concept and core mechanisms for achieving it.

references.paper_title: Characterizing the sample complexity of pure private learners
references.reason: This work establishes crucial theoretical limits of pure differential privacy in machine learning, shaping our understanding of its capabilities and constraints.

references.paper_title: Private PAC learning implies finite Littlestone dimension
references.reason: This paper provides a fundamental connection between private PAC learning and online learning under differential privacy, influencing algorithm design and analysis.

references.paper_title: Learning quickly when irrelevant attributes abound: A new linear-threshold algorithm
references.reason: Littlestone's work established the foundational theory of online learning, providing key concepts and results used to understand the performance and limitations of private online learning.

This paper introduced the Vapnik-Chervonenkis (VC) dimension, a key concept in computational learning theory that helps to characterize the complexity of concept classes, critical for understanding private learnability.
